intro: Cuphea neubertii, commonly known as the flame wheel plant, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Lythraceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular red flowers that resemble wheels. The plant produces showy, bright red bracts that surround the small, clustered flowers, creating a vibrant display. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. Cuphea neubertii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its eye-catching appearance and ability to attract pollinators.
